body:
Comment 6 by **MarkHkamp**: 
While godoc is working as intended, I think there's plenty of room for a flag to disable
searching/indexing entirely, instead of just halfway like "-maxresults=0". During the
~60 seconds before the index (partial or full-text) is built, the godoc server takes
only 6-7mb and everything but search seems fully functional.

That pre-index state is about 99.5% as useful to me as post-index, even though it takes
only 3-4% as much memory. In my experience, when I'm looking for something that belongs
in the standard library, commands, or spec, the location is very logical and I know
where to look without a search box. If I'm looking for something else, it's not in the
documentation anyway, so searching there won't help me.

In sum, a simple "-disablesearch" flag would be a great enhancement to godoc for those
of us who just want a lightweight documentation server without search.
